be a health hazard, and is addictive) == Pakistan == All cigarettes are required by a Statutory Order 1219(I)/2008 dated 25 September 2008, published in the Gazette of Pakistan dated 24 November 2008, to carry [[rotational]] health warnings from 1 July 2009. Under the previous law, health warnings were not required to be rotated. Each health warning will be printed for a period of 6 months. The health warnings are to be in Urdu and in English. Here are the English versions: 1. WARNING: Protect children. Do not let them breathe your smoke. Ministry of Health. 2. WARNING: Smoking causes mouth and throat cancer. Ministry of Health. 3. WARNING: Quit smoking; live longer life. Ministry of Health. 4. WARNING: Smoking severely harms you and the people around you. Ministry of Health. The warnings shall cover at least 30% on both sides of the packet, and located at the top portions of the face (in Urdu) and back (in English) of the packet. == Paraguay == In Paraguay, a variety of warnings with graphic, disturbing images of tobacco-related harms (including impotence and heart attack) are placed prominently on cigarette packages. == Peru == In Peru, a variety of warnings with graphic, disturbing images of tobacco-related harms (including abortions and asthma) are placed prominently on cigarette packages. == Philippines == [[File:Warning messages on Philippine tobacco packaging.jpg|thumb|Tobacco packaging warning messages on cigarette packs sold in the [[Philippines]] prior to March 2016]] [[File:PH tobacco packaging graphic warning labels.jpg|thumb|right|Graphic tobacco packaging warning messages prior to 2018 revision]] {{See also|Smoking in the Philippines#Legislation}} All cigarette packaging sold in [[Philippines]] are required to display a government warning label. The warnings include: * Government Warning: Cigarette smoking is dangerous to your health. * Government Warning: Cigarettes are addictive. * Government Warning: Tobacco smoke can harm your children. * Government Warning: Smoking kills. In July 2014, [[Philippines|Philippine]] [[President of the Philippines|President]] [[Benigno Aquino III]] signed the Republic Act 10643, or “An Act to Effectively Instill Health Consciousness through Graphic Health Warnings on Tobacco Products", more known as the "Graphic Health Warning Act.” This law requires tobacco product packaging to display pictures of the ill effects of smoking, occupying the bottom half of the display area in both front and the back side of the packaging.{{cite news |last=Chiu |first=Patricia Denise |date=20 July 2014 |title=Aquino signs law on graphic warnings on tobacco products |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/371148/news/nation/aquino-signs-law-on-graphic-warnings-on-tobacco-products |publisher=GMA News |accessdate=22 July 2014 }} On March 3, 2016, [[Department of Health (Philippines)|Department of Health]] (DOH) secretary [[Janette Garin]] started the implementation of Republic Act 10643, requiring tobacco manufacturers to include graphic health warnings on newer cigarette packaging.{{cite news|last1=Crisostomo|first1=Sheila|title=Graphic health warning law takes effect today|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2016/03/03/1559020/graphic-health-warning-law-takes-effect-today|accessdate=March 4, 2016|work=Philstar Global|agency=[[The Philippine Star]]|publisher=Philstar|date=March 2, 2016}} With the Graphic Health Warning Act implemented, graphic health warnings are used on all newer cigarette packaging, and older packages using text-only warnings are required to be replaced by newer packaging incorporating graphic warnings.{{cite news|last=Villa|first=Jet|date=March 3, 2016|title=Starting today, cigarette packs must have graphic health warnings|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/124775/starting-today-cigarette-packs-must-have-graphic-health-warnings|work=InterAksyon|agency=[[News5]]|accessdate=March 4, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304114246/http://www.interaksyon.com/article/124775/starting-today-cigarette-packs-must-have-graphic-health-warnings|archive-date=4 March 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} The 12 new warnings, showing photos of negative effects of smoking, like [[mouth cancer]], [[Erectile dysfunction|impotence]], and [[gangrene]], are rotated every month, and on November 3, 2016, all cigarette packaging without graphic health warning messages are banned from sale. Labeling of cigarettes with "light" or "mild" is also forbidden by the Graphic Health Warning Act.{{cite act |url=http://www.doh.gov.ph/sites/default/files/policies_and_laws/ra%2010643.pdf |title=Graphic Health Warning Act |date={{date|2014-07-15|mdy}} |article=8 |articletype=Section |number=10643 |type=Republic Act |accessdate=March 29, 2015}} == Russia == {| class="wikitable" |+ Warning messages on Russian cigarette packets ! They used blunt, straight-to-the-point messages such as 'Smoking causes lung cancer'. They were later replaced by graphic warnings in August 2004. They featured gory pictures and were printed with the messages: *Smoking causes a slow painful death *Smoking harms your family *Tobacco smoke can kill babies *Smoking causes stroke *Smoking causes lung cancer *Smoking causes mouth diseases In 2016, the images and warnings were revised, with images focusing on damaged organs. The following warnings shows what is printed nowadays. *Smoking causes mouth diseases *Smoking can cause a slow and painful death *Smoking causes lung cancer *Smoking causes gangrene *Smoking causes neck cancer *Smoking harms your family *Smoking causes 92% of oral cancer From 1 January 2009, people possessing cigarettes without the SDPC ('''S'''ingapore '''D'''uty '''P'''aid '''C'''igarettes) label will be committing an offence under the Customs and GST Acts. The law was passed to distinguish non-duty paid, contraband cigarettes from duty-paid ones. == Switzerland == Switzerland has four official languages, but only has warning messages in three languages. The fourth language, [[Romansh language|Romansh]], is only spoken by 0.5% of the population, and those persons typically also speak either [[German language|German]] or Italian. Your smoking increases their risk of lung cancer and heart disease. Stop smoking for the sake of your health and that of your family and friends. For more information call (011) 720-3145 |} == South Korea == In South Korea, general warning on cigarette packaging are in force since 1976. The warning messages are: * ''From 1976 to 1989'' {{lang|ko|건강을 위하여 지나친 흡연을 삼갑시다}} (For your health, please refrain from smoking too much) * ''From December 1989 to 1996'' {{lang|ko|흡연은 폐암 등을 일으킬 수 있으며, 특히 임산부와 청소년의 건강에 해롭습니다}} (Smoking may cause lung cancer and it is especially dangerous for teenagers and pregnant women) * ''From 1996 to March 2005'' '''Front''' {{lang|ko|흡연은 폐암 등 각종 질병의 원인이 되며, 특히 임신부와 청소년의 건강에 해롭습니다}} (Smoking causes lung cancer and other diseases and it is especially dangerous for teenagers and pregnant women) '''Back''' {{lang|ko|19세 미만 청소년에게 판매할 수 없습니다}} (It is illegal to sell cigarettes to people under 19) and additionally, {{lang|ko|금연하면 건강해지고 장수할 수 있습니다}} (You can be healthy and live longer if you quit), {{lang|ko|흡연은 중풍과 심장병도 일으킵니다}} (Smoking also causes paralysis and heart diseases), {{lang|ko|흡연은 사랑하는 자녀의 건강도 해칩니다}} (Smoking also damages your beloved children), {{lang|ko|당신이 흡연하면 다른 사람의 건강도 해칩니다}} (Smoking damages others) * ''From April 2005 to April 2007'' '''Front''' 건강을 해치는 담배 그래도 피우시겠습니까? (Smoking damages your health. Do you still want to smoke?) '''Back''' 19세 미만 청소년에게 판매할 수 없습니다 (It is illegal to sell cigarettes to people under 19) and additionally, 금연하면 건강해지고 장수할 수 있습니다 (You can be healthy and live longer if you quit), 흡연은 중풍과 심장병도 일으킵니다 (Smoking also causes paralysis and heart diseases), 흡연은 사랑하는 자녀의 건강도 해칩니다 (Smoking also damages your beloved children), 당신이 흡연하면 다른 사람의 건강도 해칩니다 (Smoking damages others) * ''From April 2007 to April 2009'' '''Front''' 흡연은 폐암 등 각종 질병의 원인이 되며, 특히 임신부와 청소년의 건강에 해롭습니다 (Smoking causes lung cancer and other diseases and it is especially dangerous for teenagers and pregnant women) '''Back''' 19세 미만 청소년에게 판매 금지! 당신 자녀의 건강을 해칩니다" (It is illegal to sell cigarettes to people under 19! It hurts your children's health) * ''From April 2009 to April 2011 (a prospectus)'' '''Front''' {{lang|ko|건강에 해로운 담배, 일단 흡연하게 되면 끊기가 매우 어렵습니다}} (Smoking damages your health. Once you start smoking, it is very difficult to quit) '''Back''' {{lang|ko|19세 미만 청소년에게 판매 금지! 당신 자녀의 건강을 해칩니다}} (It is illegal to sell cigarettes to people under 19! It hurts your children's health) * From December 2016, 50% of cigarette packages must contain warning elements, of which 30% must be graphic or photographic warnings.http://www.moneyweek.co.kr/news/mwView.php?type=1&no=2015070908488059013&outlink=1 In addition to the existing warning {{lang|ko|흡연이 질병의 원인이 될 수 있다}} (Smoking can be a cause of disease), the following warning will be mandatory: {{lang|ko|흡연은 다른 사람의 건강을 위협할 수 있다}} (Smoking can harm another person's health) == Sri Lanka == In Sri Lanka, a variety of warnings with graphic, disturbing images of tobacco-related harms (including a cancer and heart attack) are placed prominently on cigarette packages. == Taiwan == The warnings in Taiwan are led by the phrase "行政院衛生署警告" (''Warning from the [[Ministry of Health and Welfare (Republic of China)|Department of Health]], [[Executive Yuan]]:''), and followed by one of the following warnings: * 吸菸有害健康 *: ''Smoking is hazardous to your health'' * 孕婦吸菸易導致胎兒早產及體重不足 *: ''[[smoking and pregnancy|Smoking during pregnancy]] can cause premature death and underweight birth'' * 抽菸會導致肺癌﹑心臟病﹑氣腫及與懷孕有關的問題 *: ''Smoking can cause [[lung cancer]], [[heart disease]]s, [[emphysema]] and pregnancy-related problems'' * 吸菸害人害己 *: ''Smoking hurts yourself, and hurts others'' * 懷孕婦女吸菸可能傷害胎兒，導致早產及體重不足 *: ''Smoking during pregnancy might damage the fetus, and can cause premature death and underweight birth'' * 戒菸可減少健康的危害 *: ''Quitting smoking can reduce health risk'' – no longer us Due to the Department of Health was reorganized into Ministry of Health and Welfare, the images and warnings were revised in 2014. The following warnings shows what is printed (the new warnings will use on June 1, 2014).{{cite web|url=http://law.moj.gov.tw/Eng//LawClass/LawContent.aspx?pcode=L0070031|title=Laws & Regulations Database of The Republic of China|author=|date=|website=law.moj.gov.tw|accessdate=2 April 2018}} * 吸菸導致皮膚老化 *: ''Smoking causes [[ageing of skin]]'' * 菸癮困你一生 *: ''Tobacco addiction traps your life'' * 吸菸會導致性功能障礙 *: ''Smoking causes [[sexual dysfunction]]'' * 菸害導致胎兒異常及早產 *: ''Smoking and [[second hand smoking]] causes [[birth defect|abnormality of baby]] or [[premature birth]]'' * 不吸菸，你可以擁有更多 *: ''You can have more if you quit smoking'' * 二手菸引發兒童肺炎、中耳炎、癌症 *: ''Second hand smoking causes children [[pneumonia]], [[otitis media]], or [[cancer]]'' * 吸菸影響口腔衛生 *: ''Smoking affects [[oral hygiene]]'' * 吸菸引發自己與家人中風與心臟病 *: ''Smoking causes you and your family paralyzing [[stroke]] and [[heart disease]]'' Whether the warning is the old version or the new version, it will be marked with "戒煙專線0800-636363" (Smoking Quitting Hotline: 0800-636363). == Thailand == In Thailand, a variety of warnings with graphic, disturbing images of tobacco-related harms (including a tracheotomy and rotting teeth) are placed prominently on cigarette packages. A recent study showed that the warnings made Thai smokers think more often about the health risks of smoking and about quitting smoking.{{Cite web|url=http://2006.confex.com/uicc/wctoh/techprogram/P6333.HTM|title=Evaluating the Effects of Warning Labels on Adult Smokers in Thailand: Findings from the ITC Thailand Survey|work=2006.confex.com|accessdate=14 November 2009}} == Turkey == [[File:Turkishcigpack.jpg|thumb|Old Turkish [[Viceroy (cigarette)|cigarette]] packaging with a general warning]] ;Front of packaging (covers 65% of surface) {|border="0" cellspacing="8" cellpadding="0" |- | style="text-align:center;"|
'''{{lang|tr|Sigara içmek öldürür}}'''
(Smoking kills) |} or {|border="0" cellspacing="8" cellpadding="0" |- | style="text-align:center;"|
'''{{lang|tr|Sigara içmek
size ve çevrenizdekilere ciddi zararlar verir}}'''
(Smoking seriously harms you and others around you) |} ;Back of packaging (covers 40% of surface) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içenler genç yaşta ölür.}} (Smokers die younger) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içmek damarları tıkar, kalp krizine ve felçlere neden olur.}} (Smoking clogs the arteries and causes heart attacks and paralysis.) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içmek ölümcül akciğer kanserine neden olur.}} (Smoking causes lethal lung cancer) * {{lang|tr|Hamile iken sigara içmek bebeğe zarar verir.}} (Smoking while pregnant will harm the baby) * {{lang|tr|Çocukları koruyun: Dumanınızı onlara solutmayın.}} (Protect your children, don't let them breathe your smoke.) * {{lang|tr|Sağlık kuruluşları sigarayı bırakmada size yardımcı olabilir.}} (Health agencies can help you quit smoking) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içmek yüksek derecede bağımlılık yapar, başlamayın.}} (Smoking is highly addictive, don't start) * {{lang|tr|Sigarayı bırakmak ölümcül kalp ve akciğer hastalıkları riskini azaltır.}} (Stopping smoking reduces the risk of fatal heart and lung diseases) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içmek ağrılı ve yavaş bir ölüme neden olabilir.}} (Smoking can cause a slow and painful death) * {{lang|tr|Sigarayı bırakmak için doktorunuzdan ve ...’den yardım isteyin.}} (To quit smoking ask for help from your doctor and ...) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içmek kan akışını yavaşlatır ve cinsel iktidarsızlığa neden olur.}} (Smoking will slow the blood flow and cause impotence) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içmek cildin erken yaşlanmasına neden olur.}} (Smoking causes early ageing of the skin) * {{lang|tr|Sigara içmek spermlere zarar vererek doğurganlığı azaltır.}} (Smoking can damage the sperm and decreases fertility) * {{lang|tr|Sigara dumanında benzen, nitrozamin, formaldehit ve hidrojensiyanit gibi kanser yapıcı maddeler bulunur.}} (Cigarette smoke contains carcinogens such as benzene, nitrosamines, formaldehyde and hydrogen cyanide.) == Ukraine == The warning messages on Ukrainian cigarette packets are also visually similar to those in European Union countries: {| class="wikitable" |+ Warning messages on Ukrainian cigarette packets ! Message !! English translation !! Example design |- | Курiння призводить до серцево-судинних захворювань та раку легенiв. | ''Smoking causes heart diseases and lung cancer.'' | rowspan="7" |[[File:Lucky strike warning.jpg|thumb|Warning on [[Lucky Strike]] pack from [[Ukraine]]]] |- | Курiння викликає залежнiсть, не починайте курити. | ''Smoking is highly addictive, don't start.'' |- |Курiння викликає iмпотенцiю. |''Smoking causes impotence.'' |- |Захистiть дiтей: не дозволяйте їм дихати вашим димом. |''Protect your children, don't let them inhale your smoke.'' |- |Курiння під час вагiтностi шкодить вашiй дитинi. |''Smoking while pregnant harms your child.'' |- |Тютюновий дим шкодить здоров’ю тих, хто вас оточує. |''Cigarette smoke harms those around you.'' |- |Курцi помирають рано. |''Smokers die younger.'' |} == United States of America == [[File:Surgeon General's warning cigarettes.jpg|thumb|[[Surgeon General]]'s warning on a cigarette pack, 2012.]] In 1966, the United States became the first nation in the world to require a health warning on cigarette packages.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/06/22/health/policy/22smoke.html| title = U.S. Releases Graphic Images to Deter Smokers | newspaper = New York Times| author = Duff Wilson| date = 21 June 2011}}{{cite book|last=Satcher|first=David|title=Tobacco Use Among U. S. Racial Ethnic Minority Groups: African Americans, American Indians & Alaska Natives, Asian Americans & Pacific Islanders, Hispanics|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=5Sn4xuHBfmkC&pg=PA299|accessdate=30 May 2016|date=1998-04-01|publisher=DIANE Publishing|isbn=9780788177958|pages=299–}} In 1973, the Assistant Director of Research at R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company wrote an internal memorandum regarding new brands of cigarettes for the youth market. He observed that, "psychologically, at eighteen, one is immortal" and theorized that "the desire to be daring is part of the motivation to start smoking." He stated, "in this sense the label on the package is a plus."{{cite web|last=Teague|first=Claude E.|title=Research Planning Memorandum on Some Thoughts About New Brands of Cigarettes for the Youth Market|url=http://legacy.library.ucsf.edu/tid/ict68d00/pdf|accessdate=4 May 2014}} In 1999, Philip Morris U.S.A. purchased three brands of cigarettes from Liggett Group Inc. The brands were: Chesterfield, L&M, and Lark.{{cite web|last=Philip Morris U.S.A.|title=Circular No. 719|url=http://legacy.library.ucsf.edu/tid/cep67c00/pdf|accessdate=4 May 2014}} At the time Philip Morris purchased the brands from Liggett, the packaging for those cigarettes included the statement "Smoking is Addictive". After Philip Morris acquired the three Liggett brands, it removed the statement from the packages.{{cite web|last=Keane|first=Denise|title=Written Direct Testimony of Denise F. Keane|url=http://legacy.library.ucsf.edu/tid/whk79a00/pdf|accessdate=4 May 2014}} Though the United States started the trend of labeling cigarette packages with warnings, today the country has one of the least restrictive labelling requirements on their packages.Dumas, Bethany K. “An Analysis of the Adequacy of Federally Mandated Cigarette Package Warnings.” Ch. 11 of Language in the Judicial Process, ed. J. N. Levi and A. G. Walker. NY: Plenum Press Corp., 1990, 309–352. Reprinted Tennessee Law Review 59.2 (1992), 261–304. Warnings are usually in small typeface placed along one of the sides of the cigarette packs with colors and fonts that closely resemble the rest of the package, so the warnings essentially are integrated and do not stand out with the rest of the cigarette package. However, this is subject to change as the [[Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act]] of 2009 requires color graphics with supplemental text that depicts the negative consequences of smoking to cover 50 percent of the front and rear of each pack. The nine new graphic warning labels were announced by the FDA in June 2011 and were required to appear on packaging by September 2012, though this was delayed by legal challenges.{{cite news|title=Health Groups Weigh In On Lawsuit Over Graphic Cigarette Labels |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/09/20/health-groups-graphic-cigarette-labels_n_972102.html |deadurl=yes |work=Huffington Post |date=20 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140228043226/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/09/20/health-groups-graphic-cigarette-labels_n_972102.html |archivedate=28 February 2014 }} In August 2011, five tobacco companies filed a lawsuit against the FDA in an effort to reverse the new warning mandate. Tobacco companies claimed that being required to promote government anti-smoking campaigns by placing the new warnings on packaging violates the companies' free speech rights.{{cite news|title=US cigarette makers sue over graphic warning labels|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-14553228|work=BBC.co.uk|publisher=BBC|accessdate=17 August 2011|date=17 August 2011}} Additionally, [[R.J. Reynolds]], [[Lorillard]], [[Commonwealth Brands Inc.]], Liggett Group LLC and [[Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company]] Inc. claimed that the graphic labels are an unconstitutional way of forcing tobacco companies to engage in anti-smoking advocacy on the government's behalf.{{cite news| url=https://blogs.wsj.com/law/2011/09/12/fda-defends-new-graphic-cigarette-labels/ | work=The Wall Street Journal | first=Nathan | last=Koppel | title=FDA Defends New Graphic Cigarette Labels | date=12 September 2011}} A [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution|First Amendment]] lawyer, [[Floyd Abrams]], represented the tobacco companies in the case, contending that requiring graphic warning labels on a lawful product cannot withstand constitutional scrutiny.{{cite web|url=http://www.adweek.com/news/advertising-branding/big-tobacco-gets-top-first-amendment-lawyer-new-suit-134200|title=Big Tobacco Gets Top First Amendment Lawyer for New Suit|work=AdWeek}} The Association of National Advertisers and the American Advertising Federation also filed a brief in the suit, arguing that the labels infringe on commercial free speech and could lead to further government intrusion if left unchallenged.{{cite web|url=http://www.csnews.com/top-story-tobacco_cos._get_allies_in_warning_label_fight-59535.html|title=Tobacco Cos. Get Allies in Warning Label Fight|work=Convenience Store News|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120520151204/http://www.csnews.com/top-story-tobacco_cos._get_allies_in_warning_label_fight-59535.html|archivedate=20 May 2012|df=dmy-all}} On 29 February 2012, U.S. District Judge Richard Leon ruled that the labels violate the right to [[Freedom of speech in the United States|free speech]] in the [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution|First Amendment]].{{cite news| url=http://www.news-record.com/content/2012/03/01/article/judge_blocks_graphic_images_on_cigarette_packages | work=Winston-Salem Journal | first=Richard | last=Craver | title=Judge blocks graphic images on cigarette packages | date=1 March 2012}} However, the following month the [[United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit|U.S. Court of Appeals for the 6th Circuit]] upheld the majority of the Tobacco Control Act of 2009, including the part requiring graphic warning labels. In April 2013 the Supreme Court declined to hear the appeal to this ruling, allowing the new labels to stand. As the original ruling against the FDA images was not actually reversed, the FDA will again need to go through the process of developing the new warning labels, and the timetable and final product remain unknown.{{cite web|url=http://www.journalnow.com/business/business_news/local/article_cb836c3c-ab6e-11e2-a089-001a4bcf6878.html|title=Graphic tobacco warning labels to remain, but look, timetable unknown|work=Winston-Salem Journal|accessdate=23 April 2013}}{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/03/19/us-tobacco-labels-idUSBRE82I0VX20120319|title=Court: Tobacco health labels constitutional|work=Reuters|accessdate=23 April 2013|date=19 March 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://thehill.com/blogs/healthwatch/public-global-health/295255-supreme-court-rejects-challenge-to-tobacco-warnings|title=Supreme Court rejects challenge to tobacco warnings|work=The Hill|accessdate=23 April 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://consumerist.com/2013/04/22/supreme-court-agrees-cigarette-warning-labels-dont-violate-big-tobaccos-free-speech/|title=Supreme Court Agrees: Cigarette Warning Labels Don’t Violate Big Tobacco’s Free Speech|work=Consumerist|accessdate=23 April 2013}} === Cigars === * SURGEON GENERAL WARNING: Cigar Smoking Can Cause Cancers Of The Mouth And Throat, Even If You Do Not Inhale. * SURGEON GENERAL WARNING: Cigars Are Not A Safe Alternative To Cigarettes. * SURGEON GENERAL WARNING: Tobacco Smoke Increases The Risk Of Lung Cancer And Heart Disease, Even In Nonsmokers. * SURGEON GENERAL WARNING: Cigar Smoking Can Cause Lung Cancer And Heart Disease. * SURGEON GENERAL WARNING: Tobacco Use Increases The Risk Of Infertility, Stillbirth, And Low Birth Weight. * SURGEON GENERAL WARNING: This Product Contains/Produces Chemicals Known To The State Of California To Cause Cancer, And Birth Defects Or Other Reproductive Harm. Stronger warning labels started to appear in May 2010. === Smokeless tobacco === [[File:Theo Cope 121610.jpg|thumb|A can of [[Copenhagen (tobacco)|Copenhagen]] with the warning label.]] [[File:US Smokeless Tobacco Warning Labels.jpg|thumb|The four warning label variants seen on various [[chewing tobacco]] products sold in the United States.]] Effective June 2010, the following labels began to appear on smokeless tobacco products (also known as chewing tobacco) and their advertisements. * WARNING: This product can cause mouth cancer. * WARNING: This product can cause gum disease and tooth loss. * WARNING: This product is not a safe alternative to cigarettes. * WARNING: Smokeless tobacco is addictive. The new warnings are required to comprise 30 percent of two principal display panels on the packaging; on advertisements, the health warnings must constitute 20 percent of the total area.{{Cite web|url=http://www.fda.gov/syn/html/ucm2023662 |title=Smokeless Tobacco Product Warning Labels |publisher=Fda.gov |date= |accessdate=15 March 2011}} == Venezuela == For many years in Venezuela, the only warning in cigarette packs was printed in a very small typeface along one of the sides: "{{lang|es|Se ha determinado que el fumar cigarrillos es nocivo para la salud, Ley de impuesto sobre cigarrillos}}" (It has been determined that cigarette smoking is harmful to your health, Cigarette Tax Law) Since 14 September 1978 On 24 March 2005, another warning was introduced in every cigarette pack: "Este producto contiene alquitrán, nicotina y monóxido de carbono, los cuales son cancerígenos y tóxicos. No existen niveles seguros para el consumo de estas sustancias" (This product contains [[tar]], [[nicotine]] and [[carbon monoxide]], which are carcinogenic and toxic. There are no safe levels for consumption of these substances". 1978's warning, was not removed, now every cigarette pack contains both warnings (one on each lateral). In addition, since 24 March 2005, one of the following warnings is randomly printed very prominently, along with a graphical image, occupying the 100% of the back of the pack (40% for the text warning and 60% for the image): * {{lang|es|Este producto es dañino para la salud y produce adicción}} (This product is hazardous to your health and is addictive){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen1.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Fumar causa mal aliento, pérdida de muelas y cáncer de boca}} (Smoking causes bad breath, tooth decay and mouth cancer){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen2.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Fumar causa cáncer de pulmón, tos, enfisema pulmonar y bronquitis crónica}} (Smoking causes lung cancer, coughing, pulmonar emphysema and chronic bronchitis), the picture is a comparison between a smoker's lung (left) and a healthy lung (right){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen9.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Fumar causa infarto al corazón, Q.E.P.D. al portador, muerto por fumador}} (Smoking causes cardiac infarction, R.I.P. bearer, Killed by smoking){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen6.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Fumar durante el embarazo daña la salud de tu bebé}} (Smoking while pregnant harms your baby){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen4.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Los niños y niñas comienzan a fumar al ver adultos fumando}} (Children start smoking when they see adults smoke){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen7.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Fumar cigarrillos causa cáncer de laringe}} (Smoking cigarettes causes larynx cancer){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen3.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Fumar causa impotencia en los hombres}} (Smoking causes impotence in men){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen5.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|El humo del cigarrillo afecta también a quien no fuma}} (Cigarette smoke also harms those who don't smoke){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen10.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} * {{lang|es|Da hoy el primer paso, dejar de fumar es posible}} (take today your first step, quitting is possible){{cite web|url=http://www.mpps.gob.ve/campanas/cigarrillo/images/imagen8.jpg |accessdate=6 February 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Also, in Venezuela, tobacco advertising is strictly forbidden, so much so that the words tobacco, cigarette, cigar, etc. are not permitted in media such as radio and television and no one can smoke on television. In the campaign called: "Venezuela 100% libre de humo" (Venezuela, 100% smoke-free), curiously, these warnings only appear on cigarette packs and not on other tobacco products (which only conserve the 1978 warning). == Vietnam == In Vietnam, a variety of warnings with graphic, disturbing images of tobacco-related harms (including a tracheotomy and rotting teeth) are placed prominently on cigarette packages. == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{commons|Cigarette packet warning signs}} * [http://www.tobaccolabels.ca/ Tobacco Labelling Resource Centre] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110624233224/http://www.life.com/gallery/61761/warning-graphic-cigarette-labels#index/0 Warning: Graphic Cigarette Labels] — slideshow by ''[[Life magazine]]'' * [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/health/3022350.stm BBC News Online: "Spoof cigarette warnings slammed"] * [http://eur-lex.europa.eu/pri/en/oj/dat/2001/l_194/l_19420010718en00260034.pdf Directive 2001/37/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 5 June 2001] * [https://archive.org/details/tobaccoarchives UCSF Tobacco Industry Videos Collection] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080817113015/http://www.quitnow.info.au/ Quit Now, website advertised on Australian packets of cigarettes] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20150327004405/http://global.tobaccofreekids.org/files/pdfs/en/WL_status_report_en_low.pdf Cigarette Package Health Warnings International Status Report - Fourth Edition] {{Smoking nav}} {{labeling}} {{Cigarettes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tobacco Packaging Warning Messages}} [[Category:Tobacco control]] [[Category:Packaging]] [[Category:Cigarettes]] [[Category:Safety]] [[Category:Hazards]] [[Category:Health effects of tobacco]]

The '''weathering hypothesis''' was first proposed by [[Arline Geronimus]] in 1992. It holds that [[African-American women|African American women's]] health deteriorates in early adulthood as a result of their cumulative exposure to socioeconomic disadvantage.<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Geronimus |first=A. T. |date=1992 |title=The weathering hypothesis and the health of African-American women and infants: evidence and speculations |journal=Ethnicity & Disease |volume=2 |issue=3 |pages=207–221 |issn=1049-510X |pmid=1467758}}</ref> Subsequent studies by her and others have found support for the hypothesis.<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Geronimus |first=Arline T. |title=Black/white differences in the relationship of maternal age to birthweight: A population-based test of the weathering hypothesis |url=http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/027795369500159X |journal=Social Science & Medicine |volume=42 |issue=4 |pages=589–597 |doi=10.1016/0277-9536(95)00159-x}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal |last=Geronimus |first=Arline T. |last2=Hicken |first2=Margaret |last3=Keene |first3=Danya |last4=Bound |first4=John |date=2011-10-10 |title=“Weathering” and Age Patterns of Allostatic Load Scores Among Blacks and Whites in the United States |url=http://ajph.aphapublications.org/doi/10.2105/AJPH.2004.060749 |journal=American Journal of Public Health |language=en |volume=96 |issue=5 |pages=826–833 |doi=10.2105/ajph.2004.060749}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal |last=Love |first=Catherine |last2=David |first2=Richard J. |last3=Rankin |first3=Kristin M. |last4=Collins |first4=James W. |date=2010-07-15 |title=Exploring Weathering: Effects of Lifelong Economic Environment and Maternal Age on Low Birth Weight, Small for Gestational Age, and Preterm Birth in African-American and White Women |url=https://academic.oup.com/aje/article/172/2/127/146518 |journal=American Journal of Epidemiology |language=en |volume=172 |issue=2 |pages=127–134 |doi=10.1093/aje/kwq109 |issn=0002-9262}}</ref> In recent years, the hypothesis has been examined with regard to phenomena such as [[allostatic load]], [[epigenetics]], and [[telomere]] shortening.<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Geronimus |first=Arline T. |date=2013-09-10 |title=Deep Integration: Letting the Epigenome Out of the Bottle Without Losing Sight of the Structural Origins of Population Health |url=http://ajph.aphapublications.org/doi/10.2105/AJPH.2013.301380 |journal=American Journal of Public Health |language=EN |volume=103 |issue=S1 |pages=S56–S63 |doi=10.2105/ajph.2013.301380|pmc=3786760 }}</ref> ==Origin== While working part-time at a school for pregnant teenagers in [[Trenton, New Jersey]], Geronimus first noticed that the teens who came to the school tended to have far more health problems than her classmates at [[Princeton University]]. She thus began to wonder whether the health conditions of the teens at that clinic may have been caused by their environment. While in graduate school, she proposed the "weathering hypothesis". She chose the term [[weathering]] as a metaphor for the effects she perceived that exposure to stress was having on the health of marginalized people.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2018/01/14/577664626/making-the-case-that-discrimination-is-bad-for-your-health |title=Making The Case That Discrimination Is Bad For Your Health |last=Demby |first=Gene |date=2018-01-14 |website=NPR |language=en |access-date=2018-04-18}}</ref> ==See also==
